name: Amr

attributes.attribute: continually gives a new measurement to those who try

sources: Monaghan, Patricia. The Encyclopedia of Celtic Mythology and Folklore. Checkmark Books, 2008.
text: Arthurian hero Amr, or Anir, was a lesser-known individual who was allegedly the son of King Arthur and whose life ended tragically at the hands of his own father. His final resting place in Wales, known as the Countless Stones, is impossible to gauge as any attempts to do so result in new measurements each time (see Countless Stones).
